Imprint.Description: The Vampire Counts are amongst the most legendary factions of Vampires to have ever terrorised the civilised lands of the Old World, all of whom are members of the unholy Von Carstein bloodline. From the Imperial government and the patriotic citizenry of the Empire, the Vampire Counts are considered by many to be fiends without equal. They seek only to topple the civilisations of the living and supplant them with an Undead Empire that will reign forever as Lords of the Night. The Vampire Counts are powerful necromancers as well as warriors, given supernatural enhancements to their strength, cunning, beauty, and ambition. However, these vampires, for all their power and cunning, are ultimately base, selfish creatures driven by the same motivations as the mortals they deem themselves superior to. They are remorseless in their advance, killing without thought of mercy or compassion, and whose motives are entirely based on their own selfish desires. For all their refinement, these vampires are nothing but rotting corpses held together by Dark Magic and the horrific consumption of mortal blood

SpecialRules.MayUseInvocation: The Vampire may use Invocation of Nehek to increase units of Skeleton Warriors beyond their starting size, and adds +1 to his casting roll when casting Invocation of Nehek on these units

Powers.Name: Spectral Form
Powers.Rule: The Vampire is Ethereal. However, it may not join non-Ethereal units, nor may it be mounted or take any magic items

Powers.Name: Ghoulkin
Powers.Rule: If your army contains any Vampires with this power, your units of Crypt Ghouls (and accompanying characters) may make a march move before the game. This move is made after deployment, but before the dice roll for first turn.

Powers.Name: Master of the Black Arts
Powers.Rule: The Vampire generates an additional 2 Power dice for itself in each of its own Magic phases

Powers.Name: Forbidden Lore
Powers.Rule: In addition to Invocation of Nehek the Vampire knows all of the spells from either the Lore of the Vampires or any one of the Lores of Magic
Powers.Description: In addition to Invocation of Nehek the Vampire knows all of the spells from either the Lore of the Vampires or any one of the Lores of Magic in the Warhammer rulebook (except Lore of Life!)

Powers.Name: Dark Acolyte
Powers.Description: This Vampire has an additional Magic level

Powers.Name: Flying Horror
Powers.Description: This Vampire has the Fly special rule

Powers.Name: Infinite Hatred
Powers.Description: The Vampire Hates all enemies and may re-roll failed rolls to hit in every round of close combat

Powers.Name: Hunter in the Dark
Powers.Description: If on foot, the Vampire has the Scout special rule

Powers.Name: Red Fury
Powers.Description: For each unsaved wound that the Vampire causes it gets to immediately make an additional attack. These additional attacks do not benefit from the Red Fury rule. The Red Fury ability cannot be combined with a great weapon

Powers.Name: Avatar of Death
Powers.Description: The Vampire wears heavy armour and is armed with either a great weapon, hand weapon and shield or two hand weapons

Powers.Name: Dread Knight
Powers.Description: The Vampire has a lance, heavy armour, a shield and rides a barded Nightmare

Powers.Name: Aura of Dark Majesty
Powers.Rule: All enemy units within 6" of one or more Vampires with Aura of Dark Majesty suffer a -1 penalty to their Leadership (cumulative with any other modifiers)

Powers.Name: Walking Death
Powers.Description: The presence of one or more Vampires with this power in a combat adds +1 to their side's combat resolution

Powers.Name: Beguile
Powers.Rule: At the beginning of the Close Combat phase, after challenges, select one model in contact with the Vampire. The Vampire may re-roll to Wound against the chosen model unless the target passes a Leadership test with a -3 modifier

Weapon.Name: Frostblade
Weapon.Description: If a model suffers one or more Wounds from the Frostblade (after saves, etc) they are slain outright and lose all remaining Wounds

Weapon.Name: Dreadlance
Weapon.Description: Lance. Attacks with the Dreadlance hit automatically

Weapon.Name: The Black Axe of Krell
Weapon.Description: Great weapon. The Black Axe does D3 Wounds. Any model wounded by die Black Axe but not slain must pass a Toughness test at the start of each of its subsequent turns or suffer an additional Wound

Weapon.Name: Blood Drinker
Weapon.Rule: For each unsaved wound inflicted by the Blood Drinker, the wielder (or unit he is with) immediately regains a single Wound suffered earlier in the battle, as if Invocation of Nehek had been cast on them

Weapon.Name: Sword of Kings
Weapon.Description: This weapon has the Killing Blow special rule. If given to a Wight King it scores a Killing Blow on a 5+

Weapon.Name: Tomb Blade
Weapon.Rule: If the bearer is in a unit of Skeleton Warriors, for each model he slays in close combat an extra model is added to the unit following the rules given in the Invocation of Nehek spell. Newly created models arc equipped the same as the rest of the unit

Weapon.Name: The Balefire Spike
Weapon.Description: Lanee. Attacks with the Balefire Spike are flaming

Armour.Name: Walach's Bloody Hauberk
Armour.Description: The wearer has a 4+ armour save that may be combined with steeds, shield, etc. Walach's Bloody Hauberk also confers a 5+ ward save

Armour.Name: The Accursed Armour
Armour.Description: Heavy armour. The wearer has +1 Toughness, but suffers -3 Weapon Skill and -3 Initiative

Armour.Name: The Flayed Hauberk
Armour.Description: The Flayed Hauberk grants the wearer a 2+ armour save that cannot be improved by any means (shield, mount and so on)

Armour.Name: Armour of Night
Armour.Rule: Enemies suffer a -2 to hit penalty
Armour.Description: Models on foot only. Heavy armour. As long as the wearer is on his own, enemies suffer a -2 to hit penalty when shooting at him

Armour.Name: Nightshroud
Armour.Rule: Enemy models lose all charging bonuses, lose the Always Strikes First rule
Armour.Description: Light armour. Enemy models wishing to attack the wearer lose all charging bonuses, lose the Always Strikes First rule (if diey have it) and have their Initiative reduced to 1

Armour.Name: The Cadaverous Cuirass
Armour.Description: Heavy armour. Killing Blow and/or Poisoned Attacks have no additional effect against the wearer

Weapon.Name: The Hand of Dust
Weapon.Rule: Bound Spell (power level 3). When successfully used, this item inflicts 2D6 Strength 5 hits on one unit in base contact with the bearer, distributed as shooting hits. Roll a dice each time the Hand is used. On a 1, the power is exhausted and it cannot be used again during the battle

Weapon.Name: Rod of Flaming Death
Weapon.Rule: Bound Spell (power level 3). When used, this item casts a magic missile with a range of 18" that inflicts D6 Strength 4 hits. Any unit taking one or more wounds from this attack must immediately take a Panic test. Roll a dice each time the Rod of Flaming Death is used. On a 1, the power is exhausted and the Rod of Flaming Death cannot be used again during the battle

Weapon.Name: Helm of Commandment
Weapon.Rule: If the wearer is not in combat, one friendly Undead unit within 12" (not mounts) may use his Weapon Skill instead of their own for that Close Combat phase

Weapon.Name: The Cursed Book
Weapon.Rule: For one round of combat, enemy models are reduced to WS 1 when rolling to hit the bearer
Weapon.Description: One Use Only. For one round of combat, enemy models are reduced to WS 1 when rolling to hit the bearer

Weapon.Name: Talisman of the Lycni
Weapon.Description: A Vampire with the Talisman of the Lycni has a Movement value of 9

Additional.Name: The Carstein Ring
Additional.Rule: The first time the wearer of this ring is slain roll a D6 at the end of the phase. On a score of 2+ the vampire is immediately returned to 'life' with a single Wound
Additional.Description: The first time the wearer of this ring is slain roll a D6 at the end of the phase. On a score of 2+ the vampire is immediately returned to 'life' with a single Wound. The returning model must be placed in the front rank of a friendly unit anywhere on the battlefield (even one in close combat). If there is no unit for the Vampire to join, it is removed as a casualty

Additional.Name: Crown of the Damned
Additional.Description: Grants the bearer a 4+ ward save, but the bearer is subject to Stupidity

Additional.Name: Wristbands of Black Gold
Additional.Rule: 3+ ward save against ranged attacks of any kind (including war machines, templates, magic missiles, etc)
Additional.Description: Grants the bearer a 3+ ward save against ranged attacks of any kind (including war machines, templates, magic missiles, etc)

Additional.Name: The Gem of Blood
Additional.Description: When the wearer suffers its first wound in close combat (before saves, Killing Blow, multiple Wounds, etc), the gem activates. Roll a dice. On a roll of a 1 the wearer suffers the Wound as normal, and an additional Wound with no armour save allowed. On a 2+ the Wound is saved, and is rebounded onto the model that caused it, with no armour save allowed

Arcane.Name: Skull Staff
Arcane.Rule: The bearer receives +1 to casting and dispelling rolls

Arcane.Name: Staff of Damnation
Arcane.Rule: Bound Spell (power level 3). When the spell is successfully cast, friendly Undead models (and their mounts) within 12" of the bearer and in close combat each make a single attack. Any wounds caused are not counted for combat resolution in the subsequent Close Combat phase. Roll a dice each time the Staff of Damnation is used. On a 1, the power of the Staff is exhausted and it cannot be used again during the battle

Arcane.Name: The Book of Arkhan
Arcane.Rule: Bound Spell (power level 3). This item casts the spell Vanhel's Danse Macabre. Roll a dice each time the Book of Arkhan is used. On a 1, its power is exhausted and cannot be used again during the battle

Arcane.Name: Sceptre de Noirot
Arcane.Rule: The bearer raises D3+9 Zombies with each successful casting of Raise Dead

Arcane.Name: Crimson Gem of Lahmia
Arcane.Rule: At any time in the Magic phase, the bearer may sacrifice a Wound to gain one power dice

Arcane.Name: Black Periapt
Arcane.Rule: The Black Periapt allows the bearer to save one of his own unused power dice or one of the army's unused dispel dice at the end of any Magic phase, and then add it to his side's power or dispel dice pool in the next Magic phase
Arcane.Description: The Black Periapt allows the bearer to save one of his own unused power dice or one of the army's unused dispel dice at the end of any Magic phase, and then add it to his side's power or dispel dice pool in the next Magic phasee

Banner.Name: The Drakenhof Banner
Banner.Description: All models in the unit have Regeneration

Banner.Name: The Flag of Blood Keep
Banner.Rule: 4+ Ward save against ranged attacks of any kind
Banner.Description: Grants the unit a 4+ Ward save against ranged attacks of any kind (including war machines, templates, magic missiles, etc)

Banner.Name: Banner of the Barrows
Banner.Rule: All Grave Guard, Black Knights and Wight Kings in the unit (not mounts) receive +1 to hit in close combat

Banner.Name: Screaming Banner
Banner.Rule: Enemy units taking a Fear test caused by the unit carrying this banner must roll one extra dice for their test and discard the one with the lowest result

Banner.Name: Royal Standard of Strigos
Banner.Description: All models in the unit Hate all enemies

Banner.Name: Icon of Vengeance
Banner.Rule: The unit carrying this standard never takes casualties as a result of the general's death

Banner.Name: Banner of the Dead Legion
Banner.Rule: Treat the unit carrying the banner as having twice the unit strength it actually does

Banner.Name: Cursed Pennant of Mousillon
Banner.Rule: If the enemy capture this standard they immediately suffer D6 Strength 4 hits, distributed as shooting hits. The unit also suffer an additional D6 Strength 3 hits at the start of each of its turns
Banner.Description: If the enemy capture this standard they immediately suffer D6 Strength 4 hits, distributed as shooting hits. The unit also suffer an additional D6 Strength 3 hits at the start of each of its turns. The unit may abandon the Cursed Pennant at any time, in which case it suffers no further hits, but the standard is lost and so will not bestow any victory points for being captured

Banner.Name: Banner of the Endless Nightmare
Banner.Rule: The unit carrying this banner may add up to +4 to its combat resolution score for additional ranks, rather than the usual +3 bonus

Banner.Name: Standard of Hellish Vigour
Banner.Description: The unit carrying the standard may make march moves, as if it were within 6" of a Vampire

Banner.Name: Standard of Everlasting Death
Banner.Rule: If the unit with this standard loses a combat, roll a D6. On a 4+, the unit suffers one less casualty than normal

Banner.Name: Banner of Hellfire
Banner.Description: All close combat attacks by models in the unit (not mounts) are magical flaming attacks

Lord.Name: Vlad von Carstein
Lord.Description: Vlad von Carstein was the first and greatest of the Vampire Counts of Sylvania. A master swordsman and skilled general with no small aptitude in the magical arts, it was he who tainted the aristocracy of Sylvania with the curse of vampirism, and in so doing, created an Undead kingdom in the heart of the Empire.

HandWeapon.Name: Blood Drinker
HandWeapon.Rule: Each Wound restores one wound on Vlad or his unit

Armour.Name: Carstein Ring
Armour.Rule: The first time the wearer of this ring is slain roll a D6 at the end of the phase. On a score of 2+ the vampire is immediately returned to 'life' with a single Wound

Lord.Name: Count Mannfred
Lord.Description: While Vlad von Carstein was the most physically powerful of the Vampire Counts, Mannfred was the most cunning. When Vlad was slain, Mannfred did not involve himself in the infighting that would see Konrad rise to prominence. Instead, he travelled far and wide, seeking to deepen his knowledge of necromantic lore. He made an unholy pilgrimage to the ancient tombs of Nehekhara and the ancient city of Lahmia, where he wrested the secrets of the Liche Priests from bone dry papyrus and scrolls made from human skin.

HandWeapon.Name: Sword of Unholy Power
HandWeapon.Rule: For each unsaved Wound gains an extra dice in the Magic phase

Lord.Name: Vampire Lord
Lord.Description: Vampire Lords are amongst the most powerful Vampires within a Vampiric bloodline. To be a Vampire Lord is to obtain a position from which would've seen lesser Vampires perished, for within Vampiric hierarchy, it is well known that only the strongest individual within their numbers are given the right to rule over others of their kind.

Hero.Name: Mannfred the Acolyte
Hero.Description: This is Mannfred as he was during the reign of Vlad. Although not as accomplished in the Black Art as he would become, Mannfred the Acolyte is still a skillful and formidable Necromancer.

HandWeapon.Name: Sword of Unholy Power
HandWeapon.Rule: For each unsaved Wound gains an extra dice in the Magic phase

Hero.Name: Konrad von Carstein
Hero.Description: There are few things more dangerous than a violent lunatic, but one of them is an immortal violent lunatic with the strength and speed of a Vampire. Adding a literal thirst for blood to Konrad's figurative one did little for the noble's stretched sanity. The first of the von Carsteins had considered this as a potential advantage, and Konrad was one of the last of the von Carsteins to be embraced into the family.

Original.Rule: Gets +1 attack for each wound inflicted
One Bar Short of a Belfry

Hero.Name: Isabella von Carstein
Hero.Description: Daughter of the mad Count Otto von Drak, Isabella was much like many of her noble counterparts. She was vain, immoral and selfish, and cared little for anything that did not affect her personal comfort and standing. Though very intelligent, she had a classical, rather than practical, education. She was considered somewhat strange for her love of some of the more male pursuits, such as hunting and falconry, over needlework and music.

Original.Rule: May re-rolls to wound agains one enemy unless it pass a Ld test at -3

Armour.Name: Blood Chalice of Bathori
Armour.Rule: At the start of each friendly Magic phase may regains a single wound lost earlier in the battle

Hero.Name: Necromancer
Hero.Description: Necromancers are widely regarded as twisted and corrupt individuals who are obsessed with death and the avoidance of it at all costs. They are used by those magically inept Vampires to animate the broken corpses of their servants and return them to battle. To learn such dark magic, these desperate men will seek out a Necromancer or a Vampire to teach them, though this task is not without its own dangers and many aspirants have found themselves dying a grim death at the hands of their would-be tutor. Those that do survive invariably become powerful spell-casters, though their sanity is forever broken by the horrors they have witnessed.

Hero.Name: Vampire
Hero.Description: Vampires are incredibly powerful Undead creatures. Unlike most of the Undead, Vampires retain all of their intelligence and will, and hence all of their ambition and desire. This makes them very dangerous indeed, for they can continue to grow and learn, spending eternity perfecting their skills and honing their plans and schemes. Vampires serve as the lieutenants of an Undead army, whose combat prowess and adequate skills in Necromancy can help determine the outcome of a battle.

Hero.Name: Wight King
Hero.Description: Wight Kings were once ancient and immensely powerful Human Warlords that have once occupied the lands of present-day Sylvania in the days before the founding of the Empire. When imbued with Dark Magic, these ancient warlords rise from their crypts as Wight Kings, eyes glowing with unnatural life. The merest touch of their blade can drain the life from their foes, or slice through flesh and bone with effortless ease. Clad in heavy armour, their bodies are virtually invulnerable to damage, making them a common choice amongst many Undead factions as front-line field commanders.

Description.Description: Zombies are simple corpses raised by a Necromancer to be used against the enemy as simple infantry. The armaments of these unliving are extremely diverse, for any who have died on the field of battle are instantly amongst their ranks. Some might have been recently slain Imperial troopers with magnificent weapons and armour, while others may consist of simple peasants with rusted pitchforks and kitchen knives. Whatever their origins, these unliving are still used extensively by the Vampire Counts.

Core.Name: Skeleton Warriors
Core.Description: Skeletons form the mainstay of the Vampire Counts armies, and unlike Zombies, have the ability to go head-to-head against other enemy infantry. These skeletons are warriors raised from times long ago, having been slain in combat and buried with both their weapons and armour still intact. Although these warriors bare rusted swords and rotting wooden shields, these Skeletons still have a flicker of light within their sockets that indicates their spirits still linger within them, whose souls still remain trapped within the material realm.

Core.Name: Crypt Ghouls
Core.Description: Crypt Ghouls, or simply just Ghouls, are malformed humans whom have devolved themselves into a primitive existence due to the horrible consumption of dead flesh. Unlike the Undead, these still living creatures do not engage their enemy head-on and would rather attack from the shadows where they could use their adept hunting instincts and their poisonous claws to great effect.

Core.Name: Dire Wolves
Core.Description: Dire Wolves are the arisen corpses of Giants Wolves that were brought back to serve the will of a Necromancer. Like in their former life, these Dire Wolves serve as horrific pack animals that hunt the enemies of his master like the hounds of the living.

SpecialRules.Original: Flying move is restricted to a maximum of 10"
Bound spell with power level 5, all friendly Undead unit within 6" have the Always Strike First until next Magic phase

Option.Name: Balefire
Option.Rule: For each Corpse Cart with Balefire within 24" enemy wizard suffer a -1 modifier to casting

Option.Name: Unholy Lodestone
Option.Rule: If friendly unit within 6" is target by Invocation of Nehek, the unit gain an additional wound
